name: Hostel Chapter Two Tokyo
description: Chapter Two is a small, family-run hostel not far from Skytree Station in Asakusa. The dorms are modern, immaculate, and nicely equipped. You can book a deluxe pod, which gives you a partitioned-off bed with partial walls and a privacy curtain. They sometimes have two-night minimums.
highlights: Great place to meet people
Co-working space for digital nomads
Rooftop patio for relaxing and mingling

name: The Millennials Shibuya
description: This hostel is modern with all the amenities in a central location in Shibuya. It's great for digital nomads with a coworking area, private booths, and free beer every evening. The smart beds and rain showers add to the high-tech experience.
highlights: Free beer every evening
Lots of common areas including a coworking space and rooftop terrace
Fully equipped kitchen with free coffee/tea

name: Hostel Bedgasm
description: Located in East Tokyo, Hostel Bedgasm has a lively bar and guests get a free drink every night. The place has a DIY vibe, but is super fun and social, making it one of the best hostels on the list if you want to meet people.
highlights: Lively bar (with buy one get one free drinks)
Chill rooftop patio for hanging out
Party hostel vibe

name: Nui. Hostel & Bar Lounge
description: Nui is a nice hostel for travelers who want to socialize but don’t want to stay in a party hostel. The staff is very friendly and welcoming, and there are many different common areas to enjoy.
highlights: Popular local cafe/bar downstairs
Lounge and rooftop terrace to hang out in
Fully equipped kitchen

name: Imano Tokyo Hostel
description: Imano Tokyo is centrally located in Shinjuku, known for its great nightlife. The hostel offers brand-new and comfortable beds with privacy curtains, reading lights, and individual sockets. It's a great hostel for female travelers with separate floors for men, women, and mixed.
highlights: Centrally located in Shinjuku
Cafe/bar as well as a common area to hang out in
New beds with privacy curtains, reading lights, and outlets

name: Unplan Kagurazaka
description: Unplan Kagurazaka is a stylish hostel with a variety of room styles, making it suitable for solo travelers to families. The public café serves excellent coffee and turns into a bar at night. Breakfast is free and hearty, making it a great choice for groups and families.
highlights: Large private rooms great for groups/families
Hearty free breakfast included
Café/bar on-site for relaxing and meeting people

name: CITAN Hostel
description: CITAN is a hipster paradise in the Nihonbashi area, with a relaxed common area, good kitchen, and pod-style beds with curtains. The hostel also features an amazing coffee shop, bar, and restaurant on-site.
highlights: Quiet neighborhood
Bar, restaurant, and café all on-site
Great showers (awesome water pressure)

name: Toco Tokyo Heritage Hostel
description: Toco Tokyo offers the unique experience of sleeping in a traditional wooden Japanese home with modern conveniences. The bunks have thick mattresses and curtains for privacy. Female-only dorms are available, and guests get a free drink every night.
highlights: Traditional Japanese style building and garden
Bar/lounge
Female-only dorms
